business.headline: Centre approves Madhya Pradesh's request for soybean procurement at MSPUnion Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan confirmed that the proposal from the Madhya Pradesh government was received and approved late Tuesday.

Centre lifts minimum export price cap on onion, basmati riceThe $950 per tonne minimum export price for basmati rice has been removed while the export duty on onion has been cut to 20 per cent from 40 per cent, in effect from September 14.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Will it double investors' wealth on market debut?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: With the GMP indicating a significant upside, all eyes are now on whether the shares will live up to the hype and deliver the bumper listing gains many expect.

Trump allies plan to privatise Fannie and Freddie, says reportThe discussions involve prominent figures close to Trump, including Larry Kudlow, the former director of the National Economic Council, and John McEntee, who previously worked in the White House.

Sebi chief addresses conflict of interest allegations with 3 big clarificationsThe Buchs firmly denied any wrongdoing, offering detailed explanations to counter allegations tied to consulting roles, rental income, and Madhabi Puri Buch's ICICI Bank stock options.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as markets take breather after strong rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 135.83 points to 82,926.88, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 43 points lower at 25,345.90.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Cash in on listing day or wait for long-term gain? Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

Sebi chief, husband reject conflict of interest charges, call it false, motivatedIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

PN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusPN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: If you've applied for the IPO, you can check the allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites of the BSE and Bigshare Services.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Got allotment? Check expected listing gainsBrokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.
Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Can't keep insulting me like this: Mamata Banerjee to doctors outside homeJunior doctors protesting against the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar hospital did not meet with West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee after they persisted with the demand to livestream the discussions.

Soldier injured as Army foils infiltration bid in Jammu and Kashmir's RajouriThis was the second infiltration attempt by terrorists in Nowshera in the past week. Earlier on September 9, two heavily armed terrorists were killed near the LoC in the Laam area of this sector.

What Kamala Harris and Donald Trump think of legalising marijuanaTimes are changing, and it is, therefore, going to be an interesting election on November 5, with both candidates leaning in similar directions, despite numerous other disagreements.

Karnataka BJP MLA arrested for death threat to contractor, using casteist slursKarnataka BJP MLA Munirathna was arrested after he made a death threat and used casteist slurs allegedly against a contractor, who filed cases against him.

Ananya Panday says 'every industry should have Hema Committee' for women's safetyDuring a special session at India Today Mind Rocks 2024 Youth Summit, actor Ananya Panday stressed the importance of women's safety in the film industry. She referred to the Hema Committee report and talked about establishing a body like that in every film industry.

Randeep Hooda-Lin Laishram visit Lalbaugcha Raja, skip VIP accessRandeep Hooda and his wife, Lin Laishram, visited Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja Pandal on Friday to seek blessings from Lord Ganesha. In a video, the couple can be seen forgoing their VIP privileges and joining the public for darshan.

Fittest cricketer in India? Bumrah's reply divides fans on social mediaIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's reply to the question, 'who is the fittest cricketer from India' has landed him in hot water. A section of India's cricketing fan base has called out Bumrah for being arrogant.

Blast in central Kolkata injures ragpicker; bomb disposal squad on siteA blast at an intersection in Kolkata injured a 54-year-old ragpicker. A bomb disposal squad and forensic team arrived at the site to initiate investigations.

Truck rams family of three, drags their bike for 6 metres in JaipurA speeding pickup truck in Jaipur rammed a bike carrying a couple and their child, dragging the vehicle for nearly six metres before the driver fled the scene. The victims sustained serious injuries and are undergoing treatment.

5 arrested for throwing stones at Vande Bharat during trial run in ChhattisgarhA Vande Bharat Express train, which was on its trial run in Chhattisgarh's Mahasamund district, was attacked by some people on Friday night.

Tamil Nadu woman goes to cops with harassment complaint, they arrest herWhile recommending a probe against the accused officials, the Tamil Nadu State Women's Commission said  the cops could do that only because the victim was a woman.

India's son insulted in US: PM jabs Congress on India Today reporter assaultPM Modi, speaking at a rally in Kashmir, accused the Congress of 'indulging in brutality' after an India Today journalist said he was assaulted by Rahul Gandhi's team.

Women's safety in entertainment: TV stars and their call for change in industryRecent discussions on women's safety in the entertainment industry have been intensified by the #MeToo movement and the Hema Committee Report, both highlighting the need for reforms to protect women from harassment and abuse. For this Cinematic Saturday, several stars have shed light on how this issue extends beyond films to television, as they advocate for safer working conditions on shooting sets.

Building collapses in UP's Meerut, many feared trappedPolice and fire department personnel are present at the spot and rescue operations are on. No casualties have been reported so far due to the incident.

Over 100 people, including children, fall ill after eating biryani at DMK eventThe incident occurred after party cadres held a general meeting for members and distributed welfare items to the public. Biryani was served to the attendees, with some taking it home to share with their families.

Delhi sees year's cleanest air quality after record September rainDelhi exceeded both its annual and seasonal average rainfall in the early days of September, with total rainfall crossing the 1,000 mm mark.
Earth to get new moon as planet's gravity captures rare space rockEarth's new mini-moon will loop around the planet but will not complete a full orbit.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Video: CPM workers take Sitaram Yechury's body to AIIMS Delhi for donationCPI(M) workers took the body of Sitaram Yechury, who died on September 12, to AIIMS Delhi from the party headquarters for donation. As per his wishes, Sitaram Yechuri's body will be donated to AIIMS for medical research purposes.

Mysterious signal heard across the planet kept humming for nine daysInstead of the usual earthquake rumble, the signal was a continuous hum with only one vibration frequency, and it lasted for nine days.

Officer Black Belt review: Kim Woo-bin in an action-comedy hits the right chordReleased-Sat Sep 14, 2024Officer Black Belt on Netflix is a film about a man with many talents. Jung-Do is a nine-time black belt champion, and he would do anything in life as long as he's having fun out of it.

Delhi Police files case over firecrackers burst outside Arvind Kejriwal's homeThe Delhi government on Monday announced a ban on the production, sale and use of firecrackers in the national capital to control air pollution in the coming winter season.

Harmanpreet Singh double gives India 2-1 win over PakistanIndia extended their dominance over Pakistan with a thrilling 2-1 comeback victory in their final Asian Champions Trophy group-stage match, securing a perfect record and advancing to the semi-finals in a fiercely competitive encounter.
PM Modi welcomes new member 'Deepjyoti' to family, shares videoPrime Minister Narendra Modi shared pictures and a video on X where he can be seen petting and kissing the calf, 'Deepjyoti'.

Randeep Hooda-Lin Laishram visit Lalbaugcha Raja, skip VIP accessRandeep Hooda and his wife, Lin Laishram, visited Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja Pandal on Friday to seek blessings from Lord Ganesha. In a video, the couple can be seen forgoing their VIP privileges and joining the public for darshan.

Filmmaker Anubhav Sinha on Bheed, Anek's failure: It breaks your heartFilmmaker Anubhav Sinha recently expressed his disappointment over the box office failures of his films Bheed and Anek. He shared that such experiences can certainly discourage a filmmaker from making more movies.

Watch: Jr NTR video calls fan battling cancer, reassures his mother Jr NTR recently video-called a 19-year-old fan battling blood cancer and offered words of encouragement. A video of the interaction has gone viral on social media.

Officer Black Belt review: Kim Woo-bin in an action-comedy hits the right chordReleased-Sat Sep 14, 2024Officer Black Belt on Netflix is a film about a man with many talents. Jung-Do is a nine-time black belt champion, and he would do anything in life as long as he's having fun out of it.

sports.headline: De Ligt credits Onana's penalty save behind Man United's win over SouthamptonPremier League: Manchester United defender Matthijs de Ligt credited goalkeeper Andre Onana for turning the tide against Southampton on Saturday. United registered 3 goals after Onana's penalty save in the 34th minute of the game.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag praises Marcus Rashford after Southampton winManchester United boss heaped praise on Marcus Rashford after the England forward broke his 13-game goal drought during the win over Southampton on Saturday, September 14.

ISL: Farukh, Chima on target as Chennaiyin start campaign with 3-2 win over OdishaChennaiyin FC broke Odisha FC's 569-day-long unbeaten home streak in a come-from-behind victory in the Indian Super League on Saturday, September 14. Chennaiyin beat Odisha 3-2 with Farukh Choudhary scoring a brace.

Marcus Rashford ends 13-game drought as Manchester United beat Southampton 3-0Manchester United returned to winning ways as Marcus Rashford and Matthijs de Ligt were amongst the goalscorers as they beat Southampton  3-0 on Saturday, September 14.

Ugandan athlete Rebecca Cheptegei gets 'gun salute' in emotional funeralRebecca Cheptegei, the Olympic athlete who died last week in Kenya after her partner set her on fire was given 'gun salute' at a military funeral on Saturday, September 14.

Virat Kohli fan shares kind gesture by star batter during practice in ChepaukVirat Kohli's humble gesture of obliging for pictures with fans and a chat has been winning hearts online, once again showcasing his deep connection with fans while preparing for the upcoming Bangladesh Test series.

Asian Champions Trophy: Semi-finals confirmed as China defeat Japan 2-0China defeated Japan 2-0 to book their spot in the semifinals in the Asian Champions Trophy 2024 on Saturday, September 14. India will now play Korea in the semifinal while Pakistan will face China in the other one.

Tottenham Hotspur vs Arsenal: H2H, all you need to know about North London derbyTottenham Hotspur will welcome Arsenal to the Tottenham Hotspur stadium for this season's first instalment of the North London derby on September 15, Sunday.

Salt lauds Jacob Bethell after 2nd T20I: 'Not many can take down Adam Zampa'ENG vs AUS: England stand-in captain Phil Salt lauded 20-year-old Jacob Bethell for his sensational 44 off 24 balls in the 2nd T20I. Bethell was especially impressive against spinner Adam Zampa during his match-winning knock.

Bethell was especially impressive against spinner Adam Zampa during his match-winning knock.

Tilak Varma announces comeback from injury with hundred in Duleep Trophy 2024Duleep Trophy 2024: Tilak Varma announced his comeback from injury in style with a spectacular hundred. He scored an unbeaten knock of 111 for India A vs India D.

Maresca explains Cole Palmer snub from Chelsea's Conference league squadChelsea head coach Enzo Maresca explained Cole Palmer's exclusion from the UEFA Conference League squad, citing "load management" to prevent injuries, as Chelsea face multiple competitions this season. Palmer could still join the squad after the group stage.

Dodda Ganesh sacked as Kenya coach just one month after appointment: ReportsA month after his appointment, Dodda Ganesh was sacked as the coach of the Kenya men's national team, according to reports on September 14, Saturday.

Dhruv Jurel recalls when Joe Root's sledging left him shocked in Ranchi TestYoung India batter Dhruv Jurel recently recalled a sledging incident involving England's Joe Root from his debut series. Jurel got his career off to a terrific start winning Player of the Match in his second Test.

Duleep Trophy: Anshul picks 5-wicket haul with Rinku, Musheer and Sarfaraz scalpsDuleep Trophy 2024: India C's Anshul Kamboj picked a five-wicket haul against India B on Day 3 of the contest. This was his maiden five-wicket haul in first-class cricket.

MS Dhoni or Virat Kohli? Navdeep Singh reveals his favourite India cricketerIndia's para athlete Navdeep Singh recently revealed his favourite cricketer. Navdeep scripted history for India with a gold medal win at the Paralympic Games in Paris.

OTD in 2007: MS Dhoni's India won famous 'bowl-out' vs Pakistan in T20 World CupOn this Day in 2007, India registered a historic win in a bowl-out vs Pakistan in the inaugural edition of the T20 World Cup. India won the tie-breaker 3-0 against their arch-rivals.

Duleep Trophy: Anshul picks 5-wicket haul with Rinku, Musheer and Sarfaraz scalpsDuleep Trophy 2024: India C's Anshul Kamboj picked a five-wicket haul against India B on Day 3 of the contest. This was his maiden five-wicket haul in first-class cricket.

OTD in 2007: MS Dhoni's India won famous 'bowl-out' vs Pakistan in T20 World CupOn this Day in 2007, India registered a historic win in a bowl-out vs Pakistan in the inaugural edition of the T20 World Cup. India won the tie-breaker 3-0 against their arch-rivals.

Naomi Osaka parts ways with coach Wim Fissette after early US Open exitNaomi Osaka split her ways with coach Wim Fissette after her round two exit at the US Open 2024 last month. She wrote a heartfelt message on her Instagram story to announce the decision.

Jonty Rhodes gives hilarious rant on not being picked as India fielding coachFormer South Africa cricketer Jonty Rhodes had a hilarious take on not being picked as the fielding coach of the Indian Cricket team.

Pratham Singh scores maiden Duleep Trophy hundred for India A in explosive styleDuleep Trophy 2024: Pratham Singh notched up his second first-class hundred during Indi A vs India D match in Anantapur. This was his first-ever century in the Duleep Trophy tournament.

IND vs PAK, Hockey Highlights: India script 2-1 comeback win Skipper Harmanpreet Singh's double gave India a 2-1 comeback win over their arch-rivals Pakistan, who had initially taken early lead from an Ahmad Nadeem strike.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
